name: It is easier to picture "They were proud" than it is to picture Henry or the other recruits strutting. "They were proud" is a simpler way of saying how the recruits felt. Using this sentence instead of "They had strutted" would add to the despairing tone
value: It is easier to picture "They were proud" than it is to picture Henry or the other recruits strutting. "They were proud" is a simpler way of saying how the recruits felt. Using this sentence instead of "They had strutted" would add to the despairing tone of the paragraph.
